title: Casca and Cassius decide, on the night before the Assassination of Julius Caesar, that Mark Antony should live.
text: Casca and Cassius decide, on the night before the Assassination of Julius Caesar, that Mark Antony should live.

title: Emperor Jin Huaidi is executed by Liu Cong, ruler of the Xiongnu state (Han Zhao).
text: Emperor Jin Huaidi is executed by Liu Cong, ruler of the Xiongnu state (Han Zhao).

title: Chioggia concludes an alliance with Zadar and Trogir against Venice, which becomes changed in 1412 in Šibenik.
text: Chioggia concludes an alliance with Zadar and Trogir against Venice, which becomes changed in 1412 in Šibenik.

title: The Queen of Cyprus, Catherine Cornaro, sells her kingdom to Venice.
text: The Queen of Cyprus, Catherine Cornaro, sells her kingdom to Venice.

title: Battle of Ivry: Henry of Navarre and the Huguenots defeat the forces of the Catholic League under Charles, Duke of Mayenne during the French Wars of Religion.
text: Battle of Ivry: Henry of Navarre and the Huguenots defeat the forces of the Catholic League under Charles, Duke of Mayenne during the French Wars of Religion.

title: Thirty Years' War: Bavaria, Cologne, France and Sweden sign the Truce of Ulm.
text: Thirty Years' War: Bavaria, Cologne, France and Sweden sign the Truce of Ulm.

title: Otto von Guericke completes his book on Vacuum.
text: Otto von Guericke completes his book on Vacuum.

title: Admiral Sir John Byng is executed by firing squad aboard HMS Monarch for breach of the Articles of War.
text: Admiral Sir John Byng is executed by firing squad aboard HMS Monarch for breach of the Articles of War.

title: American Revolutionary War: Spanish forces capture Fort Charlotte in Mobile, Alabama, the last British frontier post capable of threatening New Orleans in Spanish Louisiana.
text: American Revolutionary War: Spanish forces capture Fort Charlotte in Mobile, Alabama, the last British frontier post capable of threatening New Orleans in Spanish Louisiana.

title: Battle of Wuchale: Emperor Tekle Giyorgis I pacifies a group of Oromo near Wuchale.
text: Battle of Wuchale: Emperor Tekle Giyorgis I pacifies a group of Oromo near Wuchale.

title: Eli Whitney is granted a patent for the cotton gin.
text: Eli Whitney is granted a patent for the cotton gin.

title: The Mikado, a light opera by W. S. Gilbert and Arthur Sullivan, receives its first public performance in London.
text: The Mikado, a light opera by W. S. Gilbert and Arthur Sullivan, receives its first public performance in London.

title: The Gold Standard Act is ratified, placing United States currency on the gold standard.
text: The Gold Standard Act is ratified, placing United States currency on the gold standard.

title: The Hay–Herrán Treaty, granting the United States the right to build the Panama Canal, is ratified by the United States Senate. The Senate of Colombia would later reject the treaty.
text: The Hay–Herrán Treaty, granting the United States the right to build the Panama Canal, is ratified by the United States Senate. The Senate of Colombia would later reject the treaty.

title: Pelican Island National Wildlife Refuge is established by US President Theodore Roosevelt.
text: Pelican Island National Wildlife Refuge is established by US President Theodore Roosevelt.

title: Lakeview Gusher, the largest U.S. oil well gusher near Bakersfield, California, vents to atmosphere.
text: Lakeview Gusher, the largest U.S. oil well gusher near Bakersfield, California, vents to atmosphere.

title: El Virilla train accident, Costa Rica: A train falls off a bridge over the Río Virilla between Heredia and Tibás. Two hundred forty-eight are killed and 93 wounded.
text: El Virilla train accident, Costa Rica: A train falls off a bridge over the Río Virilla between Heredia and Tibás. Two hundred forty-eight are killed and 93 wounded.

title: Alam Ara, India's first talking film, is released.
text: Alam Ara, India's first talking film, is released.

title: The first all-sound film version of Show Boat opens at Radio City Music Hall.
text: The first all-sound film version of Show Boat opens at Radio City Music Hall.

title: Slovakia declares independence under German pressure.
text: Slovakia declares independence under German pressure.

title: Orvan Hess and John Bumstead became the first in the United States successfully to treat a patient, Anne Miller, using penicillin.
text: Orvan Hess and John Bumstead became the first in the United States successfully to treat a patient, Anne Miller, using penicillin.

title: World War II: The Kraków Ghetto is "liquidated".
text: World War II: The Kraków Ghetto is "liquidated".

title: World War II: The R.A.F.'s first operational use of the Grand Slam bomb, Bielefeld, Germany.
text: World War II: The R.A.F.'s first operational use of the Grand Slam bomb, Bielefeld, Germany.

title: Korean War: For the second time, United Nations troops recapture Seoul.
text: Korean War: For the second time, United Nations troops recapture Seoul.

title: USAF Broken Arrow nuclear weapon mishap in B-52 crash near Yuba City, Ca.
text: USAF Broken Arrow nuclear weapon mishap in B-52 crash near Yuba City, Ca.

title: A jury in Dallas finds Jack Ruby guilty of killing Lee Harvey Oswald, the assumed assassin of John F. Kennedy.
text: A jury in Dallas finds Jack Ruby guilty of killing Lee Harvey Oswald, the assumed assassin of John F. Kennedy.

title: The body of U.S. President John F. Kennedy is moved to a permanent burial place at Arlington National Cemetery.
text: The body of U.S. President John F. Kennedy is moved to a permanent burial place at Arlington National Cemetery.

title: Italian publisher and former partisan Giangiacomo Feltrinelli is killed by an explosion near Segrate.
text: Italian publisher and former partisan Giangiacomo Feltrinelli is killed by an explosion near Segrate.

title: The Israel Defense Forces invade and occupies southern Lebanon in Operation Litani.
text: The Israel Defense Forces invade and occupies southern Lebanon in Operation Litani.

title: In China, a Hawker Siddeley Trident crashes into a factory near Beijing, killing 44 and injuring at least 200.
text: In China, a Hawker Siddeley Trident crashes into a factory near Beijing, killing 44 and injuring at least 200.

title: In Poland, LOT Flight 7 crashes during final approach near Warsaw, killing 87 people, including a 14-man American boxing team.
text: In Poland, LOT Flight 7 crashes during final approach near Warsaw, killing 87 people, including a 14-man American boxing team.

title: The South African government bombs the headquarters of the African National Congress in London.[1]
text: The South African government bombs the headquarters of the African National Congress in London.[1]

title: Johnson South Reef Skirmish: Chinese forces defeat Vietnamese forces in Johnson South Reef, disputed Spratly Islands.
text: Johnson South Reef Skirmish: Chinese forces defeat Vietnamese forces in Johnson South Reef, disputed Spratly Islands.

title: Timeline of Linux development: Linux kernel version 1.0.0 is released.
text: Timeline of Linux development: Linux kernel version 1.0.0 is released.

title: Space exploration: Astronaut Norman Thagard becomes the first American astronaut to ride to space on board a Russian launch vehicle.
text: Space exploration: Astronaut Norman Thagard becomes the first American astronaut to ride to space on board a Russian launch vehicle.

title: Members of the Chadian military fail in an attempted coup d'état.
text: Members of the Chadian military fail in an attempted coup d'état.

title: The Left Front government of West Bengal sends at least 3,000 police to Nandigram in an attempt to break Bhumi Uchhed Pratirodh Committee resistance there; the resulting clash leaves 14 dead.
text: The Left Front government of West Bengal sends at least 3,000 police to Nandigram in an attempt to break Bhumi Uchhed Pratirodh Committee resistance there; the resulting clash leaves 14 dead.

title: A series of riots, protests, and demonstrations erupt in Lhasa and elsewhere in Tibet.
text: A series of riots, protests, and demonstrations erupt in Lhasa and elsewhere in Tibet.
